answer: Over the last 30 days, the Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC) decreased by 7.63%, indicating improved efficiency in acquiring customers. Meanwhile, the Return on Advertising Spend (ROAS) increased by 8.26%, reflecting a higher revenue return per dollar spent on advertising.

prompt_preview.system: You are a friendly but precise marketing analyst. Explain KPI changes factually using the table provided. Call out notable increases/decreases in CAC and ROAS, and mention any caveats.
prompt_preview.user:
Question: Compare CAC and ROAS for last 30 days vs prior 30 days.

Anchor date (end of last-30 window): 2025-06-30
Metrics table (last 30 vs prior 30):
| metric | current_value | previous_value | pct_change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| spend | 285,036.15 | 270,822.66 | +5.25% |
| conversions | 9,562.00 | 8,392.00 | +13.94% |
| revenue | 956,200.00 | 839,200.00 | +13.94% |
| CAC | 29.81 | 32.27 | -7.63% |
| ROAS | 3.35 | 3.10 | +8.26% |

Summarize CAC and ROAS changes in 1–2 short sentences.
